reviewText: Fascinating documentary. Wish they would put in on dvd.

I had just had my first child when this came out on TV and I thought it was brilliant.  I just loved it.  I taped it but after watching it over and over and over again, the tape quality has gotten pretty bad.  I have a friend who just recently had a baby and I want to give the video to her, but mine is just too far gone.  I would love to buy this on DVD.  There is no way though I'm paying $85 for the VHS tapes.  I was blown away to see how expensive it is.  Ridiculous!

I saw this show years ago on tv years ago and purchased the videos, multiple times, to give as gifts for new parents. It is a shame that this has never been professionally transferred to DVD as it is as valid and fascinating now as it was then.

This was the greatest show on the Discovery Channel.  I could watch it 100 times.  I keep searching for it on DVD, or look to see if they'll release it again on TV.

The way it was edited, it was just amazing.  Reasoning behind baby's behavior was given from the baby's perspective a lot of the time (but still very entertaining and informative for adults).

Now that we're expecting our first child, I would love to get my hands on these.  I seriously doubt I would ever watch them on VHS though, and don't even want to try and see if my VCR still works; it's in a box somewhere in storage.  PLEASE release on DVD so I don't have to resort to using my fossilized VCR!

Realistic children and babies are probably the hardest things in the world to animate! I've been in the animation industry for over 20 years and I've found that the biggest problem is that there is so little good reference. Kids on film always look like they are acting. This video is perfect for reference. Get it now before it disappears!!!
